job_title: Front Office in Beaver Falls, PA
pros: Weekends off, holiday's off, full time - 20 days vacation to use after five years,  they used to have a nice bench mark every quarter ( extra money if your office met 3 different  areas) but they took that away, which is very sad. Summer events are nice.
cons: Very busy, under staffed, lots to do not enough people to do it. Took away benchmarks that everyone looked forward too. Lots of money gets wasted on dumb things like new bunn coffee pots for all the offices and  a coffee service.  People would of rather had a benchmark, especially the one we all worked for the 1st quarter. That we didnt get. That started this year , we hear its being revamped but nothings happed yet. Every company has its goods and bads, or favoritism or lack of advancement, or wrong people in their titles,  over all it's a decent place to work but deffinetly needs work to keep people.

pros: Primary Health Network has some amazing employees who create the atmosphere that keeps you coming to work.  The company gives you two weeks of personal time / vacation time from the start.
cons: C-Level management and mid management are blind as to what the network needs to function.  They only care about what benefits them and not the patient or employees.  The network has to many bosses and no leaders.  Benefits are at an extremely high cost for the employees and the executives get cream of the crop insurance.  Favoritism is rampant through the network and those who question or disagree are put out to pasture.

pros: We're really lucky to have a place like this to work in this area. The salaries are good, and the benefits are good as well.
cons: There is currently turmoil at the highest level of management. There was some sort of coup that changed senior management suddenly. Who knows how things will go from here?

job_title: MOA II, NCMA in New Castle, PA
pros: Mission statement , don't turn patients away.  40 hours , 21 days vacation , 13 paid holidays and benefits
cons: poor allowed treatment by the patients , understaffed and no raise in 5 years

job_title: Accounts Receivable Specialist in Sharon, PA
pros: Paid holidays, management works with schedules
cons: Unrealistic deadlines, co workers are also on Medicaid, pay is one of the lowest for a billing department around. New department manager also oversees another department and has no clue about anything.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Hermitage, PA
pros: Monday through Friday work week. No holidays. No weekends.  Fairly comfortable office environment.  Solid Training when you start. Interviews are relaxed.
cons: There are poor wages to start, followed by minimal raises each year.  Insurance is outrageously expensive with very poor coverage.

pros: Flexible with families, good working environment
No weekends, no holidays and no shift- work. Upward mobility is available.
cons: Pay is rarely competitive. Health insurance is very  costly.
